text:
The pt ia an unfortunate 80yo man with multiple medical problems who
   initially presented to an osh on [**9-12**] with noted weakness and a
   presumed aspiration pnx. A head ct revealed a hemorrhagic cva at the
   site of a known brain tumor. He now has left sided hemiparesis and his
   medical course at the osh has been complicated by multiple pnxs and an
   inability to wean from ventilatory support. His care has been further
   complicated by a h/o mds for which he is chronically anemic and
   thrombocytopenic. The pt has required nearly daily transfusions to
   maintain a plt count >50k and a hct >25. He was transferred to [**Hospital1 54**]
   last evening at his family request for another neurosurigal opinion.
   PMH: (in addition to the above) cad s/p cabg x4
06; afib now off
   coumadin; bilat dvt
s and pe
s s/p filter placement; prostrate ca
   ^chol; htn; copd; gout; hyperparathyroidism; peg placement
   Allergies: univasc-> electrolyte abnormalities; celexa->
   lightheadedness
   Leukocytosis
   Assessment:
   Repeat wbc 25 which is c/w previous data. Tmax 100.1 orally on arrival
   to the micu.  Pt was pancultured and the foley catheter was replaced.
   Action:
   Received Tylenol x1 prior to a plt transfusion. Receiving abx coverage
   for mrsa, psa, and c. diff.
   Response:
   Pt continues to have a low grade fever with a rising lactate level.
   Plan:
   Follow temperature curve; con
t abx coverage as ordered; micu team to
   contact osh for culture data, if cultures+, pt will likely require d/c
   of picc line and placement of another central line.
   Pneumonia, bacterial, ventilator acquired (VAP)
   Assessment:
   Pt arrived orally intubated and vented on ac. He was placed on ac
   20x500 w/peep5 and o2 100%. A repeat abg revealed a metabolic alkalosis
   of unknown etiology. The pt
s pao2 was only 75 at that time. Sats >95%.
   Lung sound rhonchorous with bibaslar rales.
   Action:
   Peep increased to 10cm for relative hypoxemia. A bedside us of the
   lungs was performed by the attending w/o evidence of an empyema. A cxr
   was also obtained.
   Response:
   Pt is tolerating a slow fio2 wean and is currently on o2 60%. Etiology
   of hypoxemia in unclear.
   [**Name2 (NI) 440**]:
   Follow serial abg
s with appropriate ventilatory changes; pt may need
   an a-line placed. Per attending, pt may also have a bronchoscopy.
   CVA (Stroke, Cerebral infarction), Hemorrhagic
   Assessment:
   Left sided hemiparesis. Pt is able to move his right arm up to his
   chest, squeeze his hand, move his right leg on the bed. Perrl @3mm.
   +corneals, gag, and cough reflexes. The pt is following simple
   commands. He is not responding to questions re: his pain status.
   Action:
   Pt transfused w/1 unit plts overnoc for a goal plt count of >50. cva
   likely hemorrhagic from the pt
s brain tumor.
   Response:
   Awaiting repeat plt count results. Neuron exam unchanged.
   Plan:
   Follow neuron exam; transfuse as needed; neurosurgical consult in the
   am.
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   +yeast perirectally. Pt has a stage II pressure sore with poorly
   defined edges is located over his coccyx. A moderate amount of bleeding
   from the wound is noted.
   Action:
   Nystatin applied to yeast. Wound was irrigated with ns and an covered
   with allevyn dsg.
   Response:
   unchanged
   Plan:
   Please contact wound care rn for a consult in the am. Consider change
   to a kinear bed.

info.concept: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
